intro: Gynura crepidioides, commonly known as the African Daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers arranged in a circular pattern, which bloom from spring to summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. It is well-suited for gardens and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
